str2: Late, in the evening. From the same as opiso; late in the day; by extension, after the close of the day.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: To dawn, be near commencing. A form of epiphauo; to begin to grow light.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
Magdalene, a woman of Magdala. Feminine of a derivative of Magdala; a female Magdalene, i.e. Inhabitant of Magdala.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A burial-place, sepulcher, tomb, grave. Masculine from thapto; a grave.
